column2: Formula effect: all-items RPI index, 2000 to 20181
Formula effect on percentage change over 12 months: all items RPI, 2000 to 2018 1
Formula effect on percentage change over 1 month: all items RPI, 2000 to 2018 1
Key:     -  zero or negligible     ..  not available

column3: These figures quantify the impact of using the Jevons formula in place of the Carli formula in the RPI, known as the 'formula effect'.
A negative value means that using the Jevons formula acts to reduce the index or percentage changes.
To calculate what the RPI would be if the Jevons formula was used in place of the Carli, these values should be added to the corresponding RPI figures presented in table 37.
For example, the percentage change over 12 months on a Jevons basis for January 2017 = RPI percentage change over 12 months for January 2017 (2.6%) + (-0.8) = 1.8%
